Expression Used when you are ready and eager to listen to someone's ideas or information.
Expression Means a situation is risky or happening at the very last possible moment,
Expression Indicates it's now someone else's turn to act or make a decision
Expression means feeling a bit sick
Expression Used to ask someone to be patient with you.
Meaning: To start a conversation or make people feel more comfortable.
cards.answer:
“Break the ice”

Example: “To break the ice at the party, I said hello to the person next to me.”

cards.question: Meaning: To do something in the easiest or cheapest way, often badly.
cards.answer:
“Cut corners” 

Example: “The company cut corners on safety to save money, which caused problems.”

cards.question: Meaning: To describe something exactly right.
cards.answer:
“Hit the nail on the head” 

Example: “You’ve hit the nail on the head with your idea about the problem.”

cards.question: Meaning: Something very easy to do.
cards.answer:
“Piece of cake” 

Example: “The test was a piece of cake; I finished it very quickly.”

cards.question: Meaning: To be very expensive
cards.answer:
“Cost an arm and a leg”

Example: “That new phone costs an arm and a leg; I can’t buy it now.”

cards.question: Meaning: To try to do more than you can manage.
cards.answer:
“Bite off more than you can chew” 

Example: “By agreeing to do two big projects at once, I bit off more than I could chew.”

cards.question: Meaning: To avoid talking about what’s important.
cards.answer:
“Beat around the bush” 

Example: “Please stop beating around the bush and tell me what happened.”

cards.question: Meaning: To be upset about something that has already happened and can’t be changed.
cards.answer:
“Cry over spilled milk” 

Example: “Don’t cry over spilled milk; let’s focus on fixing the problem.”

cards.question: Meaning: To organise yourself and improve your behaviour.
cards.answer:
“Get your act together”

Example: “You need to get your act together if you want to pass this class.”

cards.question: Meaning: To solve two problems with one action.
cards.answer:
“Kill two birds with one stone”

Example: “By walking to work, I kill two birds with one stone: I save money and get exercise.”

cards.question: Meaning: To reveal a secret by mistake.
cards.answer:
“Let the cat out of the bag” 

Example: “I let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party when I asked her what cake she likes.”

cards.question: Meaning: To work late into the night.
cards.answer:
“Burn the midnight oil” 

Example: “I’ve been burning the midnight oil to finish this project before the deadline.”

cards.question: Meaning: To do something difficult or unpleasant that you have been avoiding.
cards.answer:
“Bite the bullet” 

Example: “I finally bit the bullet and went to the dentist after waiting for months.”

cards.question: Meaning: A way of wishing someone good luck, especially before a performance.
cards.answer:
“Break a leg” 

Example: “You’re going to do great in the play tonight. Break a leg!”
